body_html:
Hi,

The problem commes from here where we check only str and not unicode. @soumith not sure how this should be fixed, should unicode be added to basestring in _six.py ?

In the meantime, you can use torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(torch.DoubleTensor) as type also accept the type directly, it does not have to be in a string.
body_text:
Hi,
The problem commes from here where we check only str and not unicode. @soumith not sure how this should be fixed, should unicode be added to basestring in _six.py ?
In the meantime, you can use torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(torch.DoubleTensor) as type also accept the type directly, it does not have to be in a string.
body:
Hi,

The problem commes from [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/5f864ca4d2cab5874e0b6779dc22f6de3a91c3e2/torch/_utils.py#L22) where we check only str and not unicode. @soumith not sure how this should be fixed, should `unicode` be added to `basestring` in `_six.py` ?

In the meantime, you can use `torch.from_numpy(np.array([1,2,3])).type(torch.DoubleTensor)` as type also accept the type directly, it does not have to be in a string.
